item.title: Digital Nomad VPN Setup
item.description:
üö® Secret - Restricted Data

How to setup a Digital Nomad VPN system

Unauthorized personnel beware!

This guide contains sensitive setup instructions.

Proceed at your own risk ‚Äî and remember, this is for educational purposes only.

Management and Tech Investigation Teams are not authorized to continue past this point.

Prerequisites

  1. Buy 2 GL.iNet routers ‚Äî one full router and one travel router.
    For recommended GL.iNet devices, click here.
  2. We‚Äôll be using WireGuard as the VPN technology.
  3. If you‚Äôre not using GL.iNet routers on both sides, this post isn‚Äôt for you.
  4. I‚Äôll use a GL.iNet Beryl AX to demonstrate both the VPN server and client setup.
  5. Terminology:
    • Server = ‚ÄúHOME‚Äù system (where you want to pretend to be).
    • Client = the device you travel with (where you actually are).
  6. LAN = Local, WAN = World.
  7. Configure port forwarding on your ISP‚Äôs modem/router. Use UDP port 51820.

VPN Server ‚Äì Where you want to pretend to be

  1. Connect a CAT‚Äë5e/Ethernet cable from your ISP modem/gateway/ONT to the router‚Äôs WAN port.
    An easy way to remember which cable goes to what devices is look at the first letter of WAN/LAN.
    WAN = World and therefore goes out the door (to your service provider), and LAN = Local and sticks inside the house.
    This goes to your computer.
